content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 8 to node 7 in the provided graph is:

1->2->6->7

Note that the path was found by starting from node 8 and following the edges in the specified order until reaching node 7. The path is not necessarily unique and depends on the edge traversals chosen. If you need the path in different order or have any other requirements, please provide more details.

The shortest path from node 8 to node 6 in the provided graph is:

1->2->8

Note that the path was found by starting from node 8 and following the edges in the specified order until reaching node 6. The path is not necessarily unique and depends on the edge traversals chosen. If you need the path in different order or have any other requirements, please provide more details.
